name: circrna-cancer-biomarkers
title: Circular RNA Biomarker Discovery (Cancer)
description: Identify and quantify circular RNAs as cancer biomarkers. Detects circRNA expression changes, miRNA sponge activity, and novel circRNAs with diagnostic or prognostic potential. Samplesheet format: `sample,fastq_1,fastq_2`
content:
Circular RNA Cancer Biomarkers

Circular RNAs (circRNAs) are covalently closed RNA molecules with exceptional stability and tissue-specific expression, making them ideal cancer biomarkers.

Why circRNAs as Cancer Biomarkers?

  • Stability: Resistant to exonucleases, stable in blood/urine
  • Abundance: Can be more abundant than linear transcripts
  • Specificity: Tissue and cancer-type specific expression
  • Detectability: Present in biofluids (liquid biopsy)
  • Dysregulation: Altered in cancer development/progression

circRNA Functions in Cancer

  • miRNA Sponges: Sequester miRNAs from tumor suppressors
  • Protein Scaffolds: Organize signaling complexes
  • Translation: Some circRNAs encode oncogenic proteins
  • Splicing Regulation: Compete with linear splicing
  • Transcription Regulation: Nuclear circRNAs regulate parent genes

Famous Cancer circRNAs

circRNA Biomarkers:

  • ciRS-7/CDR1as: miR-7 sponge, promotes cancer progression
  • circPVT1: Oncogenic, proliferation and metastasis
  • circHIPK3: Dysregulated in multiple cancers
  • circTP63: Tumor suppressor, lung cancer
  • circFBLIM1: HCC biomarker, liquid biopsy

Scientific Applications

  • Diagnosis: Early cancer detection from liquid biopsy
  • Prognosis: Survival prediction, risk stratification
  • Drug Response: Predictive biomarkers for therapy
  • Recurrence: Monitor minimal residual disease
  • Therapeutic Targets: Oncogenic circRNAs as targets

Pipeline Features

  • Back-Splice Junction Detection: Identify circRNAs from RNA-seq
  • circRNA Quantification: Accurate BSJ counting
  • Differential Expression: Tumor vs normal comparison
  • miRNA Binding Prediction: Identify miRNA sponge activity
  • Novel circRNA Discovery: Unannotated circRNAs
  • Quality Control: RIN assessment, ribosomal depletion

Input Requirements

CSV samplesheet:

  • sample: Sample identifier (tumor/normal)
  • fastq_1: Forward reads (total RNA-seq or ribo-depleted)
  • fastq_2: Reverse reads (if paired-end)

Best Practice: Use ribosomal-depleted total RNA-seq, not polyA-selected RNA-seq.

Key Outputs

  • circRNA Catalog: All detected circRNAs
  • Differential circRNAs: Cancer vs normal
  • miRNA Binding Sites: Potential sponge interactions
  • Expression Matrices: Quantification tables
  • Novel circRNAs: Unannotated discoveries

Perfect for: Cancer biomarker discovery • Liquid biopsy • Diagnostic assays • Prognostic markers • Therapeutic targets
